abstract: The next input value before the given input.
overview:
## Return Value

The next “smalller” input value that can be represented by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FormatStyle/FormatInput] or an underlying representation the format style uses internally.

## Discussion

Use this function to determine if the return value provided by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DiscreteFormatStyle/discreteInput(after:)] is precise enough for your use case for any input `y`:

If the distance between `z` and `x` is too large for the precision you require, you may want to manually probe [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FormatStyle/format(_:)] at a higher rate in that interval, as there is no guarantee for what the output will be in that interval.

# input(before:)

**Instance Method**

The next input value before the given input.

## Declaration

```swift
func input(before input: Self.FormatInput) -> Self.FormatInput?
```

## Return Value

The next “smalller” input value that can be represented by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FormatStyle/FormatInput] or an underlying representation the format style uses internally.

## Discussion

Use this function to determine if the return value provided by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DiscreteFormatStyle/discreteInput(after:)] is precise enough for your use case for any input `y`:

```swift
guard let x = style.discreteInput(after: y) else {
    return
}

let z = style.input(before: x) ?? y
```

If the distance between `z` and `x` is too large for the precision you require, you may want to manually probe [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/FormatStyle/format(_:)] at a higher rate in that interval, as there is no guarantee for what the output will be in that interval.
title: input(before:)
